TopicTitle: Ideas for the New Secret Feature in 0.25!

Articles.Content:
I've not seen this mysterious building, but to throw yet another idea out there:

The new feature is related to bankruptcy. Maybe my "repo men" idea, but whatever it is it's something funny.

The little building is a betting shop, allowing you to lose your money more quickly.

That would be hilarious, but probably unlikely.
solid scatter objects, now the rocks and trees are solid, carefull where you land and yer rovers be doooomed!!!
Meteor showers!It fits. Debris falling as a meteor shower would occur more often for experienced players as they build larger ships. What do you guys think?

Meteor showers!It fits. Debris falling as a meteor shower would occur more often for experienced players as they build larger ships. What do you guys think?

It was specifically stated that experience players are less likely to experience the secret feature, not more likely.

solid scatter objects, now the rocks and trees are solid, carefull where you land and yer rovers be doooomed!!!
It was specifically stated that experience players are less likely to experience the secret feature, not more likely.

Experienced players probably don't land on terrain scatter, does Procyon's idea fit all the criteria? It might be fun to crash rovers into boulders on a low g planet for hours.

Maybe the secret Feature is just minor Fragmented-Debris.

Like torn apart Rover-tires, ripped of solarpanels floating in orbit.

All the Kessler-Consequences.

It actually fits the criteria below and it would fit Squads workflow on bigger and better looking explosions.

They will Show it anyway tommorow

-Won't be exactly a common occurence,

Debris is of course not common in KSP

-Skilled players more often than not won't encounter it unless they deliberately do so,

Skilled Players would rather leave their debris in LKO and have it decay by the atmosphere.

-If you do encounter it, you'll have to deal with its' consequences,

What could give you more consequences than a clogged up Orbit?

-No mod has ever done it before,

I dont know of any Mod who does this. Correct me if I am wrong.

-It's a cool, but really small thing,

Small but deadly bits and pieces of Debris

-It's only possible because of all the groundwork that they put in so a big 0.26 big feature could be possible.

Well, I dont know what they are planning for .26 but if they are going on with what they have done for .25 it fits also this criteria.
